channel.title: Distrelec Jira
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6492] VAT / Oranizational number - CR
item.description:
Please implement the new VAT-ID / organizational number fields according to the specification here:

  • http://wiki.distrelec.com/display/distrelint/901c+-+Registration+Data

Backend relevant columns(in wikipage):

  • Organization Number should go into Tax 2 field in SAP
  • VAT No. should go into VAT Reg No. in SAP?

We need to have it on Q latest Monday, 02.03.2015, EOB

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Front End done.
Please assign to BE.
Need to be tested after the fix from SAP side exactly as document in wiki(http://wiki.distrelec.com/display/distrelint/901c+-+Registration+Data)
please review
SE: warning + validation text is wrong, should be: 'SE' followed by 12 digits
Problem with the VAT tooltip fixed and commited

Hi surendra, I checked the first couple of countries(see screenshots) and this is not implemented according to the specification.

The fields, mandatory fields, validations and according warning-texts should be exactly as described in the specification.

Please review and correct the errors. Let me know if you need assistance

Please test after the next deployment
thanks

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6404] Blocking issue with product hierarchy
item.description:
DO NOT GO LIVE WITH v3.2.0

Please review the DistProductInterceptor. There are two things:
a) It fails to save many products during IF-01 import. see console.log-2015-02-10.gz on node Q-0

10 Feb 2015 18:03:59 ERROR [ImpExWorker<0/3>] (00009JFR) [MultiThreadedImpExImportReader] line 6090 at main script: worker 0 got error line 6090: cannot update 8800205176833 with values ItemAttributeMap[ registry:  null, type: <null>, data: {lastmodifiederp=Wed Dec 17 00:00:00 CET 2014, codemovex=727719, transportgroup=1000(8796453525977), replacementfromdate=null, replacementuntildate=null, unit=Unit 'ROL' type 'pieces' (8796093382666), salesunit=0120(8796685720025), replacementreason=null, materialtype=ZTRA(8796093798873), producthierarchy=155200, rohs=14(8796094585305), codenavision=727719, replacementproduct=null, countryoforigin=8796096757794->JP, approvalstatus=ArticleApprovalStatus.approved(approved(8796096954459)), dangerousgoodsprofile=NDG(8796093340121), codeelfa=1032592, sequenceid=20150210180224224} ] due to [com.namics.distrelec.b2b.core.interceptor.DistProductInterceptor@81b9381]: unexpected validator error: java.sql.SQLException: ORA-01461: can bind a LONG value only for insert into a LONG column

b) And it slows down performance by deleting and re-creating items in each afterSave call.


My strong advice:

  • Check logs regularly. Especially console.log in Q BEFORE deploying a new version to production.
  • Make code reviews in your team.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
The 

DistProductInterceptor and DistCategoryInterceptor

are written by Will, so I will deactivate them and assign this ticket to him.
Please review the implementations !!!!!
The DistProductInterceptor is not used anymore.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6382] OCI // Possibility to fade out the footer
item.description:
We need the possibility to fade out the normal footer an fade in a specific OCI/ARIBA footer per customer.
This definition should be possible to handle through the HMC customer configuration --> OCI Footer: On/Off

The specific OCI/Ariba footer should only contain

  • Copyright
  • AGB
  • Impressum
  • Data privacy

You can use the cart footer.
item.summary: OCI // Possibility to fade out the footer

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please review.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5122] SEO - MicroData Optimization
item.description:
Observations :

  • Microdata well tagged on webpages allow a very high CTR on the SERP.
  • We are using Price Microdata on our products :
  • We are not using the full set of microdata offered to us by Google :

Impacts :

  • We are not exploiting all the traffic we could gather due to lower CTR compared to the competition on our results inside the serps.

Demands :

Insert those Microdata tagging (https://developers.google.com/webmasters/richsnippets/) :

  • "Stock" Microdata type (only products pages with stock available):
    • Documentation : https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/146750
    • Code exemple for http://www.distrelec.ch/en/LED-lamp-warm-white-9-5-W-E27-Philips-COREPRO-LEDBULB-9-5-60W-E27/p/11042373 : 
      <div itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Product">
	<div itemprop="name">LED lamp warm white 9.5 W E27, COREPRO LEDBULB 9.5-60W E27, Philips</div>
	<div itemprop="offers" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Offer">
		<div itemprop="priceCurrency" content="CHF"></div>
		<div itemprop="price" content="13.90"></div>
		<link itemprop="availability" href="http://schema.org/InStock" />
	</div>
</div>
    • Code test : https://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/richsnippets?q=uploaded:8005036ab5453d87218f7f6fe373c989&hl=en
    • Code effect :
  • "Starting From Price" Microdata type (only Category pages)
    • Documentation : https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/146750
    • Code Exemple for https://www.distrelec.ch/en/Tools-%26-Measurement/Measuring-Instruments/Oscilloscopes/Oscilloscopes-Bench-Types/Oscilloscopes%2C-Agilent-DSO1000B/c/cat-234938 :
      A pharse saying "Price from CHF$lowest_product_price" must be added before the footer of the page and being tagged like this ($lowest_product_price="576.72") : 
      <div itemprop="offerDetails" itemscope="" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Offer-aggregate">
	Price from
	<meta itemprop="currency" content="CHF">CHF
	<meta itemprop="lowprice" content="576.72">576.72	
</div>
    • Code Exemple test : https://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/richsnippets?q=uploaded:800505ea66a4e0bf569562f368eac52d
    • Code effect :
  • "Breadcrumb" Microdata type (on Products and Category pages):
    • Documentation : https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/185417
    • Code exemple for http://www.distrelec.ch/en/LED-lamp-warm-white-9-5-W-E27-Philips-COREPRO-LEDBULB-9-5-60W-E27/p/11042373 :
      The breadcrumb already in place must be tagged like this : 
      <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb">
	<a itemprop="url" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Power-Supplies-%26-Lighting/c/cat-L1D_379521"><span itemprop="title">Power Supplies & Lighting</span></a>
</div>
<div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb">
	<a itemprop="url" href="/http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Power-Supplies-%26-Lighting/Light-sources/c/cat-L2D_379659"><span itemprop="title">Light sources</span></a>
</div>	
<div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb">
	<a itemprop="url" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Power-Supplies-%26-Lighting/Light-sources/LED-Lamps/c/cat-L3D_525567"><span itemprop="title">LED Lamps</span></a>
</div>
<div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb">
	<a itemprop="url" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Power-Supplies-%26-Lighting/Light-sources/LED-Lamps/LED-lamps/c/cat-16343"><span itemprop="title">LED lamps</span></a>
</div>
<div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb">
	<a itemprop="url" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Power-Supplies-%26-Lighting/Light-sources/LED-Lamps/LED-lamps/LED-Lamps%2C-E27-Socket/c/cat-348903"><span itemprop="title">LED Lamps, E27 Socket</span></a>
</div>
    • Code test : https://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/richsnippets?q=uploaded:8005036847c3d640f474aba15e7ff7dd&hl=en
    • Code effect :
Here is a new one, you can try it
  • "Sitelink Search Box" Microdata type (Only for the Home page):
    • Documentation : https://developers.google.com/webmasters/richsnippets/sitelinkssearch
    • Code for http://www.distrelec.ch pages html head : 
      <script type="application/ld+json">
{
	"@context": "http://schema.org",
	"@type": "WebSite",
	"url": "http://www.distrelec.ch/",
	"potentialAction": {
		"@type": "SearchAction",
		"target": "http://www.distrelec.ch/search?q={search_term_string}",
		"query-input": "required name=search_term_string"
	}
}
</script>
    • Code effect :

Checking process :

  • Copy paste of the html inside the richsnippets test plateform : http://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/richsnippets (no pre-visualization = µdata wrongly implemented !)
  • This issue can't be closed without my final live check.
  • Thank you to update the status of the implementation in the comment below.

Deprecated Demand (Don't implement it):

  • "Price" & "Stock" Microdata type (on Category pages with only one product displayed)
    • Documentation : https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/146750
    • Code Exemple for http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Tools-%26-Measurement/Measuring-Instruments/Oscilloscopes/Oscilloscopes-Bench-Types/Oscilloscopes%2C-Agilent-DSO1000B/c/cat-485635 :
      A pharse saying "Price CHF$product_price" must be added before the footer of the page and being tagged like this : 
      <div itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Product">
	<span itemprop="name">Oscilloscopes, Agilent DSO1000B
	<div itemprop="offers" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Offer">
		<span itemprop="priceCurrency" content="CHF">CHF
		<span itemprop="price" content="557.28">557.28
		<link itemprop="availability" href="http://schema.org/InStock" />In stock
	</div>
</div>
    • Code Exemple test : https://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/richsnippets?q=uploaded:8005036ab444381da09c62327bce7f5b&hl=en
    • Code effect :
  • "Price range" Microdata type (only on Category pages with more than one product displayed)
    • Documentation : https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/146750
    • Code Exemple for http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Power-Supplies-%26-Lighting/Light-sources/LED-Lamps/LED-lamps/LED-Lamps%2C-E27-Socket/c/cat-348903 :
      A pharse saying "Price from CHF$min_product_price to CHF$max_product_price" must be added before the footer of the page and being tagged like this : 
      <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Product">
	<span itemprop="name">LED Lamps, E27 Socket</span>
	<span itemprop="offerDetails" itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Offer-aggregate">
		Price from CHF
		<span itemprop="lowPrice">10.10</span>
		to CHF
		<span itemprop="highPrice">14.90</span>
		<meta itemprop="priceCurrency" content="CHF" />
	</span>
</div>
    • Code Exemple test : https://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/richsnippets?q=uploaded:8005036ab30fc481691f41d2c451ce41&hl=en
    • Code effect :

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please don't implement the sitelinksearch box yet, apparently it's bugged.

And just to be sure, every time I'm writing an url http://www.distrelec.ch/* it's for the exemple concerning http://www.distrelec.ch/.
If the domain is *.distrelec.de/de or *.distrelec.it it has to be inside the µdata the corresponding domain and language path.

Status update :

  • "Stock" Microdata : Ready in dev environment
  • "Starting From Price" Microdata : in finalization in dev environment
  • "Breadcrumb" Microdata : Ready in dev environment
  • "Sitelink Search Box" Microdata : Ready in dev environment

Hallo Ruben,

Could you do those Frontend stuff, which we had just discussed now please.

Please do it in a special branch which I had created for seo stuff ( https://svn.namics.com/Distrelec/Distrelec-Relaunch-2012-intern/branches/feature-sku-5122-seo_microdata)

Hello Surendra,
The FE is done.
Thanks

Thanks Ruben
done!.
Francesco Bersani | Distrelec could you merge the seo feature branch(feature-sku-5122-seo_microdata) please.
merge done, now the changes are on v3.0 branch

Hi Surendra
What's the status here?

        <script type="application/ld+json">
